paragraph.paragraph:
This sample shows you how to set up your first
/libraries/wel/reference/support/wel_application_chart.xml WEL_APPLICATION consisting of a single
/libraries/wel/reference/windows/wel_frame_window_chart.xml WEL_FRAME_WINDOW . This is one of the simplest WEL applications you can write, and the output is shown below:
paragraph.heading: 2Compiling

list.item: Choose Open Project from the File menu.
Navigate to <Eiffel_ENViSioN!_installation_path>\compiler\examples\(.net version)\wel\step1\ and select tutorial_step1.eifp
Clicking open loads the selected project
Select Use existing Ace (control file) and click OK
Choose the directory where the project will be compiled, by default the same directory containing the Ace file.

paragraph.heading: 2Running
paragraph.paragraph: After you launch the sample, You should see the window displayed in the screen as illustrated above. You will have full control over the window, and the program will quit when you close the window.
paragraph.note: Note: The size and shape of the window may be different on your machine.
paragraph.heading: 2Under the Hood
paragraph.paragraph:
Although this system does nothing except create and display a
/libraries/wel/reference/windows/wel_frame_window_chart.xml WEL_FRAME_WINDOW , it shows how to set up your first
/libraries/wel/reference/support/wel_application_chart.xml WEL_APPLICATION .

This sample only contains one class,
TUTORIAL_STEP1 which inherits
/libraries/wel/reference/support/wel_application_chart.xml WEL_APPLICATION and redefines main_window
